meanings.definition: A knot used to form a fixed loop at the end of a rope.
meanings.sent1: I learned how to tie a bowline during my camping trip.
meanings.sent2: The sailor quickly secured the boat with a bowline.
meanings.sent3: The bowline knot was so strong that even the mischievous wind couldn't untie it.
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a well-tied bowline, unyielding and secure.
meanings.sent5: The simplicity of the bowline knot made it easy for beginners to grasp.

meanings.definition: A type of sailing ship with two masts.
meanings.sent1: The bowline sailed gracefully across the open sea.
meanings.sent2: Many sailors preferred the speed of a bowline for their voyages.
meanings.sent3: The bowline ship looked majestic against the setting sun.
meanings.sent4: In the distance, the bowline appeared like a beautiful swan gliding on water.
meanings.sent5: The crew worked together to navigate the bowline through rough waters.
